Definition at line 85 of file nanofip.vhd.

Member Data Documentation

c_id_i in std_logic_vector ( 3 downto 0 ) [Port]

Constructor identification settings.

Constructor identification settings. Connect the ID inputs either to Gnd, Vcc, S_ID[0] or S_ID[1] to obtain different values for the Model data (i=0,1,2,3).
C_ID[i] connected to: Gnd S_ID0 SID1 Vcc
Constructor[2*i] 0 1 0 1
Constructor[2*i+1] 0 0 1 1

Definition at line 118 of file nanofip.vhd.

clock_gen [Component]

place holder for ports

Placeholder for Clock generator

Definition at line 277 of file nanofip.vhd.

dat_i in std_logic_vector ( 15 downto 0 ) [Port]

Data in.

Data in. Wishbone access only on bits 7-0. Bits 15-8 only used in stand-alone mode.

Definition at line 211 of file nanofip.vhd.

dat_o out std_logic_vector ( 15 downto 0 ) [Port]

Data out.

Data out. Wishbone access only on bits 7-0. Bits 15-8 only used in stand-alone mode.

Definition at line 215 of file nanofip.vhd.

data_if [Component]

place holder for ports

Placeholder for User Data interface

Definition at line 267 of file nanofip.vhd.

m_id_i in std_logic_vector ( 3 downto 0 ) [Port]

Model identification settings.

Identification variable settings. Connect the ID inputs either to Gnd, Vcc, S_ID[0] or S_ID[1] to obtain different values for the Model data (i=0,1,2,3).
M_ID[i] connected to: Gnd S_ID0 SID1 Vcc
Model [2*i] 0 1 0 1
Model [2*i+1] 0 0 1 1

Definition at line 110 of file nanofip.vhd.

nostat_i in std_logic [Port]

No NanoFIP status transmission.

No NanoFIP status transmission If connected to Vcc, disables sending of NanoFIP status together with the produced data.

Definition at line 160 of file nanofip.vhd.

p3_lgth_i in std_logic_vector ( 2 downto 0 ) [Port]

Produced variable data length.

Produced variable data length
000: 2 Bytes
001: 8 Bytes
010: 16 Bytes
011: 32 Bytes
100: 64 Bytes
101: 124 Bytes
110: reserved, do not use
111: reserved, do not use
Actual size: +1 NanoFIP Status byte +1 MPS Status byte (last transmitted) Note: when SLONE=Vcc, p3_lgth_i should be set to 000.

Definition at line 247 of file nanofip.vhd.

rate_i in std_logic_vector ( 1 downto 0 ) [Port]

Bit rate.

Bit rate
00: 31.25 kbit/s
01: 1 Mbit/s
10: 2.5 Mbit/s
11: reserved, do not use

Definition at line 96 of file nanofip.vhd.

place holder for ports

Placeholder for Reset logic

Definition at line 272 of file nanofip.vhd.

rston_o out std_logic [Port]

Reset output, active low.

Reset output, active low. Active when the reset variable is received and the second byte contains the station address.

Definition at line 166 of file nanofip.vhd.

Identification selection.

Identification selection (see M_ID, C_ID)

Definition at line 282 of file nanofip.vhd.

slone_i in std_logic [Port]

Stand-alone mode.

Stand-alone mode If connected to Vcc, disables sending of NanoFIP status together with the produced data.

Definition at line 155 of file nanofip.vhd.

subs_i in std_logic_vector ( 7 downto 0 ) [Port]

Subscriber number coding.

Subscriber number coding. Station address.

Definition at line 99 of file nanofip.vhd.

tx_engine [Component]

place holder for ports

Placeholder for Transmitter engine

Definition at line 257 of file nanofip.vhd.

var1_acc_i in std_logic [Port]

Variable 1 access.

Signals that the user logic is accessing variable 1. Only used to generate a status that verifies that VAR1_RDY was high when accessing. May be grounded.

Definition at line 181 of file nanofip.vhd.

var1_rdy_o out std_logic [Port]

Variable 1 ready.

Signals new data is received and can safely be read (Consumed variable 05xyh). In stand-alone mode one may sample the data on the first clock edge VAR1_RDY is high.

Definition at line 176 of file nanofip.vhd.

var2_acc_i in std_logic [Port]

Variable 2 access.

Signals that the user logic is accessing variable 2. Only used to generate a status that verifies that VAR2_RDY was high when accessing. May be grounded.

Definition at line 191 of file nanofip.vhd.

var2_rdy_o out std_logic [Port]

Variable 2 ready.

Signals new data is received and can safely be read (Consumed broadcast variable 04xyh). In stand-alone mode one may sample the data on the first clock edge VAR1_RDY is high.

Definition at line 186 of file nanofip.vhd.

var3_acc_i in std_logic [Port]

Variable 3 access.

Signals that the user logic is accessing variable 3. Only used to generate a status that verifies that VAR3_RDY was high when accessing. May be grounded.

Definition at line 201 of file nanofip.vhd.

var3_rdy_o out std_logic [Port]

Variable 3 ready.

Signals that the variable can safely be written (Produced variable 06xyh). In stand-alone mode, data is sampled on the first clock after VAR_RDY is deasserted.
